author: radekkapka
content: In the Beacon API spec, all non-2XX responses return only `application/json`. This makes sense because there are no SSZ definitions for them. My question is what is the "correct" thing to do when the client sends `Accept: application/octet-stream` and there is an error. Should the server still repond with `Content-Type: application/json` and a JSON body? Or send only the status code? In Prysm we do the former and I am strongly in favor of this because the client can always ignore the body.

author: ajsutton
content: I'd respond with JSON. It is _very_ common in HTTP to ignore the Accept header.  I'm pretty sure there's a HTTP response code to to say you don't support any of the accepted types but you definitely can't rely on it as a client.
